Name: Fragment of a cane of mosaic glass
Description: Fragment of a glass cane in blue, red and white, found in the temple of Osiris at Abydos. These canes formed the raw material for the production of objects in glass, such as the many inlays found on the site. This is an important find, demonstrating that the glass was not merely used in the temple, but produced there. It was dated by the excavator, Petrie, to the Roman Period.
